intro: Thlaspidium alpestre, commonly known as the alpine thlaspidium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Thlaspidium alpestre is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local biodiversity.
